etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in Female Soldier. From after- + guard

definitions: The sailors stationed on the quarterdeck and poop of a sailing ship, charged with operating the sails and other equipment aft of the mainmast. Now chiefly historical.
The officers on a ship. Now chiefly historical.

notes.text: Arising from their being situated in the after part of the ship.

definitions: On a large racing yacht: the crew members responsible for tactics and strategy, usually positioned towards the rear of the boat.
